medical_history.chief_complaint: Loss of vision in the right eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in good general health until six months prior when narrow-angle glaucoma developed. After bilateral laser peripheral iridectomies, she required various topical medications. Six months later, she experienced recent loss of vision in the right eye, with best-corrected visual acuity of 20/400 in the right eye and 20/50 in the left.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hyperthyroidism diagnosed three years earlier, managed with radioactive iodine; hyperlipidemia; and previous bilateral laser peripheral iridectomies.
medical_history.family_history: Her father had hypertension and diabetes; three maternal relatives died of strokes; two paternal relatives died of coronary disease.
medical_history.social_history: Works in a sedentary occupation; infrequent smoker; drinks little alcohol; has no pets; nulliparous with menses stopped four years prior.
